title: When water passes through the gills of fish, what does the fish get? - Quora

response.answer_text: The gills are a wondrously effective organ for extracting dissolved OXYGEN from the water. Oxygen dissolved in natural waters is present in tiny amounts, expressed as parts per MILLION (ppm). These links should tell you all you need to know about dissolved oxygen as it relates to fish metabolic requirements. Oxygen Needs for Fish Dissolved oxygen criteria for fish
